title: Shoucheng Holdings (0697.HK) Sees Robot Investment Returns Materialize: Flagship Projects Deliver Over 10x Returns

title: Does adding 'please' and 'thank you' to your ChatGPT prompts really waste energy?
description: The environmental question, then, is not how individual artificial intelligence prompts are phrased, but how frequently and intensively these systems are used
content:
Cut the words “please” and “thank you” from your next ChatGPT query and, if you believe some of the talk online, you might think you are helping save the planet.
The idea sounds plausible because AI systems process text incrementally: longer prompts ... [5251 chars]

title: What exactly is Grok and why is it’s AI imagery at the centre of a controversy?
description: The controversy surrounding Grok, the artificial intelligence chatbot developed by Elon Musk’s company xAI and embedded within X (formerly Twitter), has rapidly become one of the most serious flashpoints yet in the debate over AI safety, online harm and regulation in the UK.
content:
At its core is a simple but troubling question about how powerful image-generation tools are being deployed, and whether platforms are doing enough to prevent abuse.
So what exactly is Grok? Marketed as a conversational AI designed to answer question... [2398 chars]

title: Trump declares war on Tech Giants to halt soaring electric bills, forces data centers to fund new power plants
description: In an unprecedented emergency intervention, the Trump administration is preparing to confront the nation’s spiraling electricity crisis by directly targeting the trillion-dollar technology industry. title: 97% of listeners ‘can’t tell real music from AI creations’
description: A staggering 97% of listeners are unable to distinguish between music created by artificial intelligence and tracks composed by humans, a survey conducted by the music streaming service Deezer and the market research firm Ipsos has found.
content:

title: X offers safeguards as Philippines weighs blocking Grok

description: Suppliers of parts for Nvidia’s H200 ‍have paused production after Chinese customs officials blocked ​shipments of the newly approved artificial intelligence ‌processors from entering China, the ​Financial Times reported
content:

description: With its four-city nonprofit workshop tour, OpenAI aims to accelerate the integration of artificial intelligence into India’s social sector.
